item.title: Magnet is Damaged

But: I installed Magnet from the App Store, and I’m running a current Mac and the latest macOS â€“Â how can an app get damaged so that the only way to fix it is to reinstall it? item.title: Apple's Privileges
item.description: Apple’s Privileges Since iOS and the App Store are Apple’s own platforms it gets special privileges and doesn’t have to follow its own rules. Ever seen any third-party app getting such a nice screen asking for permissions? And how about the dark pattern highlighting the Enable Notificationsâ€¦ Also: Not Now? How about never? Apple gets special treatment when asking for permissions.

item.title: App Store Dark Patterns
item.description: Services are Apples Next Big Business No, I didn’t want notifications the first time you asked. Or the second time. So no, I still don’t want any notifications, even if you put them inline with the content. Apple sneakily trying to spam me.

item.title: App Store Ads for Installed Apps
item.description: Apple Knows How to Make the App Store a Premium Experience First, Apple is explicitly showing me something I’m not looking for. Second, Apple knows Audible is already installed and decides to show me the ad anyway. Apple Knows How to Make the App Store a Premium Experience.

item.title: App Store Ads for the Top Result
item.description: Ads Are Ruining the App Store Hey, wouldn’t it be cool if Apple didn’t show the app I’m searching for both as a giant ad and as a search result?1 Ads are ruining Apple’s App Store. I understand that Crunchy Bagel, the app developer, is not to blame. I genuinely adore Streaks and all of the other apps they offer. You should definitely check them out. ↩︎
